intro: Laennecia gnaphalioides, commonly known as the golden ragwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its bright yellow composite flowers and is typically found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. It blooms from late spring to early autumn, producing small, clustered flowers that attract various pollinators. Laennecia gnaphalioides is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
